授業目的: The objective of this course is for students to develop an understanding of marketing principles and acquire practical learning experience in marketing management and planning in various settings.
到達目標:
After completing this course, students will be able to:
1. Understand a range of decisions in the 21st century marketing management and planning.
2. Develop understanding of marketing frameworks such as market analysis, segmentation, targeting and positioning.
3. Develop necessary skills to apply relevant marketing tools such as the 4Ps (Product, Place, Promotion and Pricing) to a marketing plan of a specific company/product.
授業方法:
Online format: Simultaneous and Two-way via Zoom.
Reading materials are available at LUNA for class preparation. A mixture of class discussions and assignments will facilitate a deeper understanding of marketing management concepts and their applications to various business settings. Class discussions will also include the elements of a marketing plan. To facilitate the preparation of the marketing plan report, students will be given assignments such as information gathering for the market analysis of a specific product. At the end of the course, each group is required to submit a written report of a marketing plan project.

第1回: Understanding Marketing for the 21st. Century, Developing Marketing Strategies and Plan
第2回: Gathering Market Information and Forecasting Demand
第3回: Analyzing Consumer Markets, Creating Customer Value, Satisfaction and Loyalty
第7回: Planning Direction, Objectives and Marketing Supports
第8回: Developing Product and Brand Strategy, and Designing and Managing Services
第9回: Designing and Managing Integrated Marketing Communications
第10回: Designing and Managing Integrated Marketing Channels
第12回: Planning Performance Measurement and Implementation Control
第13回: Introducing New Market Offerings and Tapping into Global Markets
トピック.授業外学習2:
For class preparation of the first session, students are required to prepare a one-page essay on “what marketing means to you”. This essay can be based on your personal experience as a consumer and/or work-related experience. There is no right or wrong answer for the essay; students should feel free to write their honest opinion and experience.
(Please refer to LUNA for details)
